communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

o Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The public should have access to any unedited audio or visual recordings of ICE's enforcement operations in California between January 6, 2025 to the present. Since at least 2010, ICE has created and made public hundreds of videos of various internal agency operations, including arrests, detention, and removals. Recently ICE and accompanying agencies have released videos of operations in Los Angeles that have included a raid on MacArthur Park. Videographers accompanied the agency, and the content was shared across multiple platforms. Other operations have been videotaped and shared online by the agency. On one publicly available website, ICE videographers have uploaded videos of agency actions. Given ICE's widespread practice of recording its operations, additional and unedited recordings of ICE operations in California likely exist but have not been made public. These videos contain important information about the tactics used when arresting noncitizens and whether ICE officers are acting in a manner consistent with ICE's own protocols and state and federal due process laws. Because these video and audio records contain information about a critical government function on a matter of significant public interest and concern, FOIA mandates their disclosure.

Request:

1. Visual recordings taken by the department or contracted videographers of ICE operations to share on social media, advertising, and with news outlets, including arrests, detention, and removals, in Los Angeles between January 6, 2025, to the present. 

The Requestors:

Joey Scott and Jeremy Lindenfield are both journalists who work in news gathering, including written and visual reporting. Joey Scott is a freelance investigative journalist in Los Angeles. Jeremy Lindenfield is a journalist for Capital and Main news.

Fee Waiver

The Requestor seeks a full fee waiver on the grounds that disclosure of the requested records is in the public interest and is "likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of operations or activities of the government and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requestor." 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii). As set forth above, this request aims to further public understanding of ICE programs and practices that directly affect untold numbers of noncitizens as well as members of the public captured in video recordings of ICE enforcement actions. These policies and practices are of interest to the general public.

The public interest fee waiver provision "is to be liberally construed in favor of waivers for noncommercial requesters." McClellan Ecologic Seepage Situation v. Carlucci, 835 F.2d 1282, 1284 (9th Cir. 1987). The relevant question is whether the requested information is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government, good or bad. See judicial Watch, Inc. v. Rossotti, 326 F.3d 1309, 1314 (D.C. Cir. 2003). Disclosure of the information and report sought is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public's understanding of the treatment of immigrants during enforcement actions. The requested records also relate directly to government operations, including the use and storage of video files that potentially implicate fundamental rights and freedoms, including the right to privacy. The requested records also relate to the relationship between the federal government and private, for-profit contracted entities.

The records are not sought for commercial use, and the Requestor plans to disseminate the information disclosed through print and other media to the public at no cost. As demonstrated above, the Requestor has both the intent and ability to convey any information obtained through this request to the public and is therefore entitled to a full fee waiver under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii).

Should the request for a full fee waiver be denied, Requestor also seeks a limitation of processing fees pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii)(II) ("fees shall be limited to reasonable standard charges for document duplication when records are not sought for commercial use and the request is made by ... educational or noncommercial scientific institution ... or a representative of the news media") and 6 C.F.R. § 5.11(d)(1) (search fees shall not be charged to "representatives of the news media"). Requestor is a non-profit organization that intends to disseminate the information gathered by this request to the public at no cost, including through the Requestor's website and social media. The Requestor may publish a news story or other publication on the government's treatment of immigrants based on information gathered through this FOIA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

DEF CON 33 was a cybersecurity conference held in Las Vegas on August 7-10th of 2025. I am seeking arrest records relating to this conference. This may involve one case, or multiple. I am not seeking BWC footage. 

Search Criteria: 
A) A list of LVMPD calls to the Las Vegas Convention Center between August 7th and August 10th including date, time, case/call number, and call type/reason. 
B) Case information for an incident at / near the Venetian Hotel involving the confiscation of Flipper Zero devices and four individuals being detained or arrested. DEF CON noted that the individuals may have been DEF CON vendors. To aid in your search, one of the detained/arrested individuals may have the name Fletcher Heisler, there may have been four individuals detained/arrested, and that LVMPD interacted with Venetian Hotel Security prior to the incident. I hope this helps to locate the case. 

I am seeking the following documents:
1) Case numbers associated with these arrests 
2) Police reports, ICRs, investigation supplements, statements and transcripts of interviews, and case notes from these arrests

Please redact arrested party's personal information such as date-of-birth, phone number, home address, driver's license numbers, etc. - I am only seeking information on the context of the arrests, not information on the arrested parties.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: FOIA Request – Chicago 911 Call Data (Jan. 1, 2022 – Present) (Chicago Office Of The Inspector General)

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: FOIA Request – Chicago 911 Call Data (Jan. 1, 2022 – Present) (Chicago Office Of The Inspector General)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Copies of Chicago’s 911 call records from January 1, 2022 through the most recent date available at the time this request is processed.

For each call, please include:
- The most detailed location information available (preferably exact address and GPS coordinates)
- Police district, ward, and beat/precinct
- Date and time of the call
- Priority level
- Call type/category/classification
- Whether the call was behavioral health–related
- Any additional metadata maintained for each call
- Any data dictionaries, codebooks, or similar documentation needed to interpret the records


If the records exist in a database or other structured format (e.g., geoJSON, CSV, Excel, GIS shapefile), please provide them in that format. If parts of the data are exempt from disclosure, release all non-exempt portions.

Clarifications: 
- If the data is stored in a CAD (Computer-Aided Dispatch) or RMS (Records Management System), please export all available fields, including field names, even if they are not part of regularly published reports.
- If any requested detail is not recorded for all calls, provide it where it exists.
- If there is an official dataset name for this information, providing that dataset is acceptable as long as it includes all requested fields.
- If the dataset is updated daily, please run the export on the date the request is fulfilled.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

communications.subject: Your FOIA Request 2025-USMCFOIA-006568
communications.communication:
Good Morning Mr. Free, 

This is to acknowledge the receipt of your request and to let you know that I am the analyst assigned for processing. 

Please be aware that, whenever a FOIA requester has not received a determination within 20 working days from the date a request is perfected, they are entitled to challenge the delay.  To do this, you may submit an appeal within the SecureRelease online portal (www.securerelease.us) or by writing to the Department of the Navy, Office of the Judge Advocate General (Code 14), 1322 Patterson Ave SE, Suite 3000, Washington Navy Yard, DC 20374-5066.  If you prefer, you can also submit an appeal via email to Navy-OJAG-C14-FOIA-PA-ADMINAPPEALS@us.navy.mil.  Your appeal, if any, should include a statement indicating why you believe it should be granted.  It must be postmarked or timestamped within 90 calendar days from the date of this letter. 

Requesters also have the right to seek assistance and/or dispute resolution services from the Department of the Navy FOIA Public Liaison, Mr. Christopher Julka, at Christopher.a.julka.civ@us.navy.mil or (703) 697-0031, and may also contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) for assistance and/or dispute resolution at ogis@nara.gov or (877) 684-6448. 

Thank you for your patience as we work to complete the processing of your request.  Hope you have a great day. 

Sincerely, 
Tara M. Walters 

Commandant of the Marine Corps (ARSF) 
Headquarters US Marine Corps 
3000 Marine Corps Pentagon Rm 2B289 
Washington DC 20350-3000

Your reference number is R008301-081125 for tracking purposes.  If your request was submitted after business hours or on a weekend or holiday, the next business day will be considered the date of receipt. 
Records Requested:

Thank you for contacting HCD.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I am requesting all unedited and unaltered body-worn camera footage, dash camera footage, and in-car camera footage in the possession of the Baltimore County Police Department related to the traffic stop and arrest of Nicole M. Johnson in Essex, Maryland, on or around July 28–30, 2021.  

This request includes:
- All recordings from the traffic stop
- Footage showing the discovery of the bodies of Johnson's niece, Joshlyn Johnson, and nephew, Larry O’Neil, in the trunk
- Any officer interactions with Nicole M. Johnson
- Related dispatch audio, if available
- All police incident reports, investigative reports, supplemental reports, and case narratives connected to this incident

This request is being made for journalistic purposes to inform the public about a case of significant public interest. The materials may be used in a public-facing report and accompanying online video journalism to accurately document the incident.

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Mackenzie Shirilla July 31, 2022 Crash – Bodycam, Dashcam, and Police Reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Ohio Public Records Act, I am requesting all unedited and unaltered body-worn camera footage, dash camera footage, and in-car camera footage in the possession of the Strongsville Police Department related to the July 31, 2022 incident at 11792 Alameda Drive involving Mackenzie Shirilla, Dominic Russo, and Davion Flanagan.

This request includes:
- All recordings from the crash scene
- Any officer interactions with the involved parties
- Footage of the arrest and transport of Mackenzie Shirilla
- Related dispatch audio, if available
- All police incident reports, investigative reports, supplemental reports, and case narratives connected to this incident

I request the files and documents be provided electronically via a secure download link or as PDF files. If there are any fees for fulfilling this request, please inform me in advance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Abdul Rehman Anjum

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: FOIL Request: 08/10/2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any-and-all records, including audio or video footage, investigative files, memos, depositions, reports, emails etc., related to incidents in 2024 -- including a August 9, 2024 arrest for simple assault -- involving a Michael Lin.

If there are any datasets or tables pertaining to the requested information, please provide them in Microsoft Excel files rather than PDFs. For any relevant emails, please include all attachments to all messages.

Please do send records as they become available.

I would be happy to modify this request if doing so would reduce the time it will take you to comply. Do let me know if this would be necessary.

If any aspect of this request is unreasonable pursuant to FOIL, exempt from the law, or unavailable, that should not slow provision of the rest of the requested records.

If your agency finds a part of the request to be exempt from public release, the law requires that you do not withhold the document entirely but rather redact that part of the record.

If you choose to deny any portion of my request, please provide a written explanation for the denial, including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) authorizing the withholding of all or part of the record, as well as an explanation of why you believe disclosure is prevented by law (Article 6 Section 87.) Please also provide me with an email where I may send any appeals.

Please communicate with me by telephone or email rather than regular mail regarding my request. I would be happy to answer any questions that you have.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sanjana Bhambhani

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: PebbleGO
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide the following information:

1. Any digital correspondence with key phrases "Virginia" "Virginia state flag" "frontal nudity" or "PebbleGo Next": (email, memos, direct messages) 
2. Any digital correspondence related to House Bill 900 (HB900): (emails, memos, direct messages)
3. Lamar Consolidated ISD's Policy EFB Local:  A copy of the policy before November 19, 2024 and after November 19, 2024. 
4. List of all prohibited or restricted PebbleGo/PebbleGo Next content. Include a comprehensive list of all articles or lessons "turned off" for each grade level. For each item on the list, include the exact name and specific reason for its restriction, as well as the date the access was changed. 

The date range for this request is: August 1, 2024 to date request is fulfilled.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

title: Cumberland County Sheriffs Office Maine: International Parental Child Abduction Justin Kashuba

communications.subject: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Cumberland County Sheriffs Office Maine: International Parental Child Abduction Justin Kashuba
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records, reports, and documentation related to Cumberland County Sheriff's Office involvement during July/August 2002 international parental kidnapping of infant Justin Kashuba II.

Cumberland County Deputies provided armed escort services that facilitated the removal of a US citizen infant from the country without consent of both parents.

Given the CCSO's unfortunate and long history of dishonesty regarding these matters, this call was likely recorded as a "Civil-Standby" to assist women "grab some stuff" in the presence of "dangerous male".

Records requested for July 23, 2002 to August 23, 2002 involving any or all of the following individuals: Annette Kucia, Kory Kashuba, Justin Kashuba II, Justin Kashuba, Paula Pillar, and William Pillar:

- All incident reports and service calls to 212 Leach Hill Road, Casco, Maine
- All dispatch logs and radio communications 
- Assignment logs showing officers dispatched for escort services during the kidnapping
- Documentation of any police communication and/or coordination in passport retrieval for minor child 
- Responding Officer names, badge numbers, name of commanding officer on scene, name of shift Commander 
- Any follow-up reports regarding CCSO involvement in this matter

This was a well-known high profile incident recounted for years throughout the Lakes Region. The child was taken to Scotland and the father had no contact for over 12 months. 

This incident appears to have involved violations of federal law under 18 U.S.C. § 1204 among other crimes.

Fee waiver requested under victim rights, public accountability standards, and exercise of civil rights.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by 1 M.R.S.A. § 408(6). The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Justin Kashuba

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Thomas Henschel interaction reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Regarding an interaction with Thomas Henschel on 01/25/2013:
- All incident, dispatch log entries and arrest reports. Incident reports and case records refer to reports produced with notes and narratives, a description of what happened by the responding officer, trace reports, case notes and litigation files
- All unedited body-worn camera / bodycam recordings. I am specifically requesting the unedited body-worn camera recordings captured by all officers present for the full duration of the incident, including audio recordings associated with the footage. If any portion of the requested footage must be redacted, I ask that you clearly indicate the portions that have been redacted and provide an explanation of the legal basis for the redactions
- All 911 or calls for service logs, audio and transcripts
- All computer aided dispatch (CAD) reports and a copy of your department’s dispatch 10 signals/codes, agency dispatch signals/codes and CAD signals/codes

I request these records in their native digital formats and not in formats that degrade the accessibility of the records, such as tabular data converted to PDF or Word files. If converting the native digital format to another high-fidelity format, such as CSV or Excel, please take care not to introduce formatting inconsistencies or errors, which can occur in the conversion process (for example, encoding errors or the inclusion of internal unescaped quotation marks in CSV files). Should the records above represent certain values as numeric codes or abbreviations that are not self-explanatory, I additionally request all records necessary to interpret those codes and abbreviations.

I am a member of the news media. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Production of Responsive Records on a Rolling Basis: In the event that a portion of the present request is completed before the full request is completed, I ask that the records be produced on a rolling basis.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sarah Hopkins

communications.subject: San Francisco Police Public Records Request :: P218833-081025
communications.communication:
Dear Dillon Bergin: 
 
Thank you for your interest in public records of the San Francisco Police Department ("SFPD"). 
 
The San Francisco Police Department ("SFPD") received your request, dated August 10, 2025 and given the reference number P218833-081025 for tracking purposes. 
 
Record(s) Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Regarding an interaction with Brandon Carrillo on 11/30/2012:
- All incident, dispatch log entries and arrest reports. Incident reports and case records refer to reports produced with notes and narratives, a description of what happened by the responding officer, trace reports, case notes and litigation files
- All unedited body-worn camera / bodycam recordings. I am specifically requesting the unedited body-worn camera recordings captured by all officers present for the full duration of the incident, including audio recordings associated with the footage. If any portion of the requested footage must be redacted, I ask that you clearly indicate the portions that have been redacted and provide an explanation of the legal basis for the redactions
- All 911 or calls for service logs, audio and transcripts
- All computer aided dispatch (CAD) reports and a copy of your department’s dispatch 10 signals/codes, agency dispatch signals/codes and CAD signals/codes

I request these records in their native digital formats and not in formats that degrade the accessibility of the records, such as tabular data converted to PDF or Word files. If converting the native digital format to another high-fidelity format, such as CSV or Excel, please take care not to introduce formatting inconsistencies or errors, which can occur in the conversion process (for example, encoding errors or the inclusion of internal unescaped quotation marks in CSV files). Should the records above represent certain values as numeric codes or abbreviations that are not self-explanatory, I additionally request all records necessary to interpret those codes and abbreviations.

I am a member of the news media. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Production of Responsive Records on a Rolling Basis: In the event that a portion of the present request is completed before the full request is completed, I ask that the records be produced on a rolling basis.

Request for Explanation of Withholdings and Redactions: If this request is denied in whole or in part, please provide a reasonable description of any withheld materials and a justification for all such withholdings that includes reference to the specific exemptions authorizing withholding and specific reasons why such exemptions apply.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fsan-francisco-police-department-367%252Fbrandon-carrillo-interaction-reports-190926%252F%253Femail%253Dsanfranciscopd%252540govqa.us&url_auth_token=AAAIhlqz_6HzFpF9QbtVNXCgHbA%3A1ulJ0V%3AZ8DZlXkA1tCiNM0RwW3vM8_bXwhDY1MJANRnJdTDx3M 
 
Your request is being forwarded to the appropriate department(s) for processing and you will be notified once the request is complete. 
 
You can monitor request progress at the link below.  Thank you for using the San Francisco Public Records Center. 
 
 
San Francisco Police Department

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Kurt von Boehrens interaction reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Regarding an interaction with Kurt von Boehrens on 03/16/2022:
- All incident, dispatch log entries and arrest reports. Incident reports and case records refer to reports produced with notes and narratives, a description of what happened by the responding officer, trace reports, case notes and litigation files
- All unedited body-worn camera / bodycam recordings. I am specifically requesting the unedited body-worn camera recordings captured by all officers present for the full duration of the incident, including audio recordings associated with the footage. If any portion of the requested footage must be redacted, I ask that you clearly indicate the portions that have been redacted and provide an explanation of the legal basis for the redactions
- All 911 or calls for service logs, audio and transcripts
- All computer aided dispatch (CAD) reports and a copy of your department’s dispatch 10 signals/codes, agency dispatch signals/codes and CAD signals/codes

I request these records in their native digital formats and not in formats that degrade the accessibility of the records, such as tabular data converted to PDF or Word files. If converting the native digital format to another high-fidelity format, such as CSV or Excel, please take care not to introduce formatting inconsistencies or errors, which can occur in the conversion process (for example, encoding errors or the inclusion of internal unescaped quotation marks in CSV files). Should the records above represent certain values as numeric codes or abbreviations that are not self-explanatory, I additionally request all records necessary to interpret those codes and abbreviations.

I am a member of the news media. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Production of Responsive Records on a Rolling Basis: In the event that a portion of the present request is completed before the full request is completed, I ask that the records be produced on a rolling basis.

Request for Explanation of Withholdings and Redactions: If this request is denied in whole or in part, please provide a reasonable description of any withheld materials and a justification for all such withholdings that includes reference to the specific  exemptions authorizing withholding and specific reasons why such exemptions apply. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: PRA: Autopsy and coroner’s reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act (Government Code Section 6250 et seq.) ("CPRA”), and all other applicable laws, please disclose the following records.

Any and all autopsy, death investigation, and coroner’s reports relating to the death of:

Name: Jose Soliz, Date of birth: 03-25-1993, Date of death: 11-26-2022

If records pursuant to this request are possessed in machine-readable format such as an .xls, .csv spreadsheet file, please provide the record in this format. Please disclose these records in the format in which they are kept, e.g., .ppt, .pptx, .doc, or .docx.

The fundamental rule of the CPRA is a presumption of public access. “In other words, [A]ll public records are subject to disclosure unless the Legislature has expressly provided to the contrary.” Williams v. Superior Court, 5 Cal. 4th 337 (1993). This presumption finds further support in the California Constitution, as amended by Proposition 59 in 2004. “A statute, court rule, or other authority, including those in effect on the effective date of this subdivision, shall be broadly construed if it furthers the people's right of access, and narrowly construed if it limits the right of access.” Cal. Const. Art. 1 § 3(b)(2).

Please provide a determination on this request within 10 days of your receipt of it. If you determine that any or all of the information qualifies for an exemption from disclosure, please note whether, as is normally the case, the exemption is discretionary, and if so whether it is necessary in this case to exercise your discretion to withhold the information. If you determine that some but not all of the information is exempt from disclosure and that you intend to withhold it, please redact it for the time being and make the rest available as requested. In any event, please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any or all of the information is exempt and will not be disclosed.

Please apply a fee waiver to this request. If the request for a fee waiver is denied, please provide notification of any duplication costs exceeding $50 before you duplicate the records. If the request for a fee waiver is denied, please further provide an index of all other requests since 2018 for which a fee waiver was denied, and the reason therefore.

Please respond to this request and disclose the records electronically by email to this MuckRock email address. Please let us know if you have any questions or if we can help ensure this request is the least burdensome possible for your agency while providing a correct and full disclosure in the public interest.


Thanks so much, 

Dillon Bergin
